alert.note: Alert for Chatham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 8:50PM EST until January 04 at 2:12PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Haw River Near Bynum affecting Chatham County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Haw River Near Bynum. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, The river widens up to 400 feet across. It floods pasturelands on the right bank and woodlands on the left. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:31 PM EST Monday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Fri Haw River Bynum 11.0 11.0 Mon 8 pm EST 8.8 6.8 5.4 4.8 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning by 900 AM EST.
